summary:
Click on Contact Info to visit my blog and translator's profile on PROZ.com.

Currently researching, authoring, translating on the interbellum & WW-II for family chronicle.
Attained C2-Level German at the Goethe Institute.
Attended a one year creative writing course at the Querido Academie, Amsterdam.
Over 10 year's experience in writing and editing.

Over 10 years' experience in advising, managing, researching and publishing cultural heritage research projects. Noteworthy:
- Editorial and research publication (over 150 titles, including substantial standard reports). 
- Research-based cultural heritage stories.
Professional special interests: landscape archaeology, wetlands archaeology, wetlands infrastructure, rural settlements, (pre)historic pottery, ancient (mediterranean) water management systems.

Special skills: 
Intercultural communications negotiation, Process handling efficiency (German style), independent & team work (Swiss/Austrian peer-to-peer style), invisible/humble leadership (Dutch/American style), coaching
Digital data analysis (Access, Surfer etc.), material analysis, pottery restoration, cold-case research interpretation and outputting, 
Digital drawing & illustration (Adobe PhotoShop, Illustrator etc.), technical (analogue) drawing, web design (DreamWeaver, HTML etc.), 
Public engagement projects (field work, exhibitions, publications), 
Stories, articles in NL/UK/US/DE, translations in NL/UK/US/DE (blog),
Seasoned Aikidoka with weapons experience,
Trilingualist, TCK (third culture kid).

courses.name: Creative Writer's course at Querido Accademie, Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
My work specifically: Translation, Subtitling, Transcreation, Proof Reading, Localisation.
Industries: medical, law and technical (in general), journalism (esp. politics, health, science, society, culture, nature), entertainment ([children's] cartoons, safety-video construction site, royal society).
Like to work in subtitling in entertainment and documentary/journalism and localisation.
Trilingually educated, c1-c2 levels.
profile_positions.title: Intercultural Communicator NL-DE-US/UK

profile_positions.description:
- Researching for and writing on immigrant family WW-II chronicle (Conflict Archaeology). 
Interviewing eye-witnesses, analyzing wartime news papers, archive data, etc.
- August 2019-August 2022: Bachelor German Language Translation.

December 2018-May 2019: German course at Goethe Institute; attained C2-level German certificate.

November 2017-October 2018: attended creative writing course at Querido Academie, Amsterdam.

November 2016: Book 'The Concatenator' by Carlo van Vliet. Coaching the authoring debutant in creating a professional publication, translation and co-editing of raw Dutch language publication into British English language.

August 2015: 'De Mok, of een verhaal over het plattelandsleven in de vroege middeleeuwen'.
Translated into German and British English. (Published in Apple's iBook Store)
A research based cultural story in the broad public interest (cultural heritage). The production involved writing, editing, illustrating, translating from Dutch into British English and German, lay-outing and publishing.

May 2015: freelance archaeological field contribution to Gemeente Nijmegen, Project Lent-De Stelt2. 
Iron Age and Roman Age settlements along the main river Waal.

March 2015: freelance archaeological field contribution to IDDS-Project Leiden, Boommarkt. 
Early-Late Medieval and New Age urban settlements along the Rhine.

March 2015-June 2019: Dutch, Dutch Tribute to Cultural Heritage. 
Independent archaeological and historical research, advice on Dutch heritage policy, and digital authoring, production, editing, translation and publication.
profile_positions.title: Intercultural Communicator & Archeological Researcher

company.name: ArcheoMedia BV, Capelle aan den IJssel (near Rotterdam)

profile_positions.company: ArcheoMedia BV, Capelle aan den IJssel (near Rotterdam)
profile_positions.description:
- Project and team leadership of small and middle size field research
- Acquisitions, offers, consulting, writing requirement programs for archaeological research (PvE)
- CEO-executive, a.o. successfully effectuating company work efficiency
- Contractors range from the building industry, governments to private persons
- GPS and various databases
- Certificate for safety at construction sites (CSCS, Dutch: VCA-leidinggevende).

168 archaeological projects ranging from desktop research (55) and coring research (76) to surveys (16), assistance of civic engineers' excavations (13) and full scale excavations (8) in rural and city areas.

Research areas: the Western Dutch coastal dunes and peat areas (wetlands) of Zeeland, North- and South-Holland and Utrecht, the Mid-Southern Dutch river areas of South-Holland, Utrecht, North-Brabant and Limburg, and the Southern Dutch cover sand area's of North-Brabant, Gelderland and Limburg.

Over 150 research publications on Dutch archaeology, incl. (pre)historic wetlands development, diachronic river area and cover sand settlement research and city development.
Please see the attached list of publications.

General knowledge of pottery and other find categories from the Bronze Age to the New Age with light emphasis on hand-made late prehistoric pottery (spec. Southern Dutch cover sand area) and early medieval pottery (spec. South- en North-Holland) identification, analysis, report and technical drawing.

Professional special interests: landscape archaeology, wetland archaeology, wetland infrastructure, rural settlements, (pre)historic pottery, ancient (mediterranean) water management systems.
profile_positions.title: Contract Archaeologist

profile_positions.description:
Project manager, involving supporting the business team in the rent and retrieval of medical appliances, i.e. global multiligual problem solving via tele- en web-communication in Dutch, English, German and French, and company process management, upgrading the work-flow. 
Also used former job skills as a web designer/developer, involving PR-support, development and support for the company website.
profile_positions.title: Project manager, process manager, web designer

profile_positions.description: Multimedia developer & organising executive; products involve business training, business promotion (presentation, CD's or DVD's, websites) and e-learning for the (petro-)chemical and food & drink industries.
profile_positions.title: Initiator, Project manager and web designer/developer

profile_positions.description:
- assisting the municipal archaeologist as a junior archaeologist, executing inner city and rural excavations in teams.
- working out research results: registration, cleaning, technical drawing of e.g. pottery, wooden and leather artefacts, find identification, research).
profile_positions.title: Project archaeologist

company.name: State Museum of Antiquities / Rijksmuseum van Oudheden, Leiden

profile_positions.company: State Museum of Antiquities / Rijksmuseum van Oudheden, Leiden
profile_positions.description:
Assisting in the organisation of ROMEC (Roman Military Equipment Congress) 1995 and organising exhibitions using multimedia: Valkenburg (S-H) and Roman military equipment i.c.w. the experimental archaeological Roman martial group 'Stichting Gemina Project'.

Publications:
1994	Present .... Pilum! The infantry and cavalry soldier of the Roman army in the 1st century A.D. (bilingual NL/UK multi media presentation), RMO, Leiden.
1995/96   Inhabitants and Occupants. Roman Military and Civilian Life Along the Roman Frontier, based on excavations at Valkenburg Zuid-Holland. Bilingual NL/UK exhibition in co-operation with Robert M. van Dierendonck (ROB, Amersfoort), RMO, Leiden.
profile_positions.title: Assistant to the curator of the Provincial Roman department

profile_positions.description:
Assistance to Michiel Bartels in his DeltaPlan dissertation research project on Late Medieval and New Age pottery by investigating cesspit deposits from the Dutch cities Deventer, Dordrecht, Nijmegen and Tiel. Research resulted in the widely accepted and used Deventer system of cataloguing Dutch pottery of the above mentioned ages.
The assistance involved: cataloguing research data, technical drawings, conservation of Late Medieval pottery etc.

Contribution to the publication:
1999	Bartels, M., City in Sherds: Finds from the cesspits in Deventer, Dordrecht, Nijmegen and Tiel (1250-1900), Zwolle.
profile_positions.title: archaeological research assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: A very fruitful experience at the time, dealing with exhibitions, multi media and script writing, collaborating with the museum staff, assisting the attendees of the ROMEC congress, I helped organise and execute.
